dict.acceptation: 已婚的；与…结为夫妻的；婚姻的；
（使）结婚( marry的过去式)；娶；嫁；紧密结合的；

sent.orig: Li Bin suspects, male, born in 1976, Chengdu, and married, married a 6-year-old son.
sent.trans: 犯罪嫌疑人李斌，男，1976年出生，成都人，已婚，膝下有一6岁的儿子。

sent.orig: She is married and has two kids. but she has not enjoyed since she got married.
sent.trans: 她是已婚妇并有两个孩子。但她结婚后并不享受婚姻生活。

sent.orig: I hate all this travel; I want to get married married and settle down.
sent.trans: 我讨厌过漂泊的日子，我想结婚过安定的生活。

sent.orig: "We're going to be married, married people help each other."
sent.trans: 她问，“我们快要结婚了，应该互相帮助嘛。”

sent.orig: I've often said that when I married Ronnie, I thought I'd married an actor.
sent.trans: 我曾多次说过，当我嫁给里根时，我以为自己嫁的就是一个普通演员。
